chargeHist.descr: Deliver Cocaine-2nd or subsequent offense, within 1000 feet of a park (<=1g)
Deliver Cocaine-2nd or subsequent offense within 1000 feet of park (>1-5g)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kendrick L. MILLER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain full-time employment/work search/combination.

Obtain high school diploma, GED or HSED.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

Counsel argue the motion to dismiss the criminal complaint.  Court comments, and states an initial appearance occurs when a defendant appears before a judge not a court commissioner.  Court does not believe there was any unreasonable delay to the defendant and the preliminary hearing was held within the statutory time limits.  Defense motion is denied.   
Defense counsel argues for a modification of defendant's bail to delete the daily reporting condition.   State objects.  Court denies the motion, defendant did not have an objection to a daily reporting and it will remain in effect.   
ARRAIGNMENT 
Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 07-30-15 at 3:30 p.m.   Plea date is set for 11-10-15 at 8:30 a.m.   
Minutes.

RE:  Deliver cocaine, on 05-19-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 3 counts deliver cocaine within 1000 feet of a park, possess cocaine as repeater and possess THC as repeater. The matters are continued for initial appearance on 06-01-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $7,500.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with Monica Bieber and maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs. Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
